name: Amsterdam Camping Vliegenbos
description: Best Campsite in Amsterdam! Public Bus to the CC needs 15min.

name: Camperpark Zeeland
description: Campers only! Place for 100 campers on the lake 'Veerse Meer'. You can stay per hour or per day. It's check in/check out by yourself. The price in 'Mid season' is ‚Ç¨ 17,50 per day (without electricity = ‚Ç¨ 4,00 per 24 hours)

name: SBP Outdoor
description: SBP Outdoor, beautifull and quite campground at the edge of the forest.

name: fam Hutten
description:
possibility for camping tent caravan or under the sky.
Near Efteling and beekse bergen.

name: Oudewater, next to the inline skate track.
description:
Soft soil when wet, perfect for 4x4.
5g internet

name: Camping Tee Drucht
description: Nice Little Family-based Campsite. Warm Shower, shared kitchen, and very quiet:) Enjoy

name: Schutterspark, Brunssum.
description: Parking lot in a park. Quiet. Safe. Next to sport facilities. Several other camper vans present.

name: Camping Boszicht
description: Great quiet, clean and very friendly campsite.  ‚Ç¨17.10 for 2 with vehicle.

name: Landgoedcamping Westerwolde
description:
Nice established small camping situated in the woods of National Park Hoge Veluwe. One good and clean ablution block. The sites alongside the forest give you the feeling you are camping in the middle of the woods. Camp fire allowed!
The only downside is some noise from a nearby road and railway.

name: Camping Meidoorn
description:
One Toy. Landcruiser PopUp and two adults 16‚Ç¨.
Clean showers and toilets.
Walking distance from Sluis center, good bars and restaurants!

name: Camping Warnsborn
description: Very well equipped campground with various large lawns with fixed places. Many facilities for children. Adjacent to forest with walking and cycling paths. Small kitchen. Separate fields for campers/caravans and tents. Fee EUR 19.75 (2adults, camper), shower EUR 0.60.

name: Landgoedcamping Het Meuleman
description: Large campground in forest environment. Well maintained ablutions. Fee about EUR 25 per night (2 adults, camper).

name: Alongside the Princes Margriet Canal
description:
It is a docking site for boats with the possibility of parking large vehicles. Overnight stay is allowed. You stay directly on the banks of the canal with lots of marine traffic; commercial as well as private vessels. Very nice to watch from your chair. Hardly any cars since this is a dead end street. Free of charge.
Plenty of motor homes using this location when we visited but loads of space.

name: Maassluis
description: Several designated Aires parking sites for motorhomes at the ferry carpark. About 10 designated parks but no problem to camp overnight in the other parks. No facilities. Watch the shipping traffic and a good restaurant 100m walk along the riverfront. 3 additional sites on the west side of the canal have power available but very popular so you need to arrive early.

name: Rozenburg
description: Several parking sites along the Noordzeeweg that can be used for overnight motorhome camping. No facilities but quiet with access to walking tracks along the river. Easy access to Rotterdam port.

name: Sint Philipsland
description:
Harbour, parking lot, waterfront. Nice spot on the seaside of the dike. Good view. In front of a historic windmill.
No facilities, free. Small village , small supermarket.

name: westerschelde
description: Westerschelde. Parking spot on the riverfront. Good view over the river. Free. Not sure whether its legal to stay overnight.

name: Gas Las Centrum
description: Fills propane cylinders while you wait. Has some adapters for different cylinders. For us an automotive adapter worked

name: Camping Duinhorst
description:
Nice camp very close to The Hague. 
It's on one of the main roads but surprisingly not to hear! 
You can rental bicycles for ‚Ç¨6.50 a day and to cycle to The Hague centre takes about 15mins.
‚Ç¨ 22.40 f√ºr two people a night

name: Vakantiepark Kijkduin
description: Did not stay here as they asked a ridiculous price of ‚Ç¨ 43 for one night!

name: Slot Loevestein
description: Place for 5 campers close to the river de Maas and Castle Loevenstein.

name: bush camp
description: unpaved road   near shelter no service   in winter very quiet.  in summer a few hikers

name: Maaldrift
description: Rather nondescript camping with reasonably good public transport to Leiden. Lawns with hedges in between. No internet. Sanitary dump station. 2 adults & camper EUR 19, electricity, showers and hot water for dish washing at an aditional fee.

name: Klein Hemelrijk
description:
This campground belongs to the Dutch Nature Campgrounds Chain (Natuurkampeerterreinen - www.natuurkampeerterreinen.nl).  Campgrounds of this chain have basic, but well maintained ablutions and are usually situated in a nature area. It is required to buy a EUR 15 membership card that is valid for a year and can be used for all 133 campgrounds in the Netherlands.

Klein Hemelrijk is situated next to a nature park with beautiful bicycle routes in the dunes. In the past part of the campground was called Berenweide. It has different lawns with camping places, some of which are accessible by cars. Bicycles can be rented at the place. Membership cards are sold here. Ablutions are well maintained. Free use of fridge. Electricity is charged separately (‚Ç¨3). Fee ‚Ç¨23 (2 adults, camper). A park permit is included in the fee. Open April-October. Cash payment only.

name: Minicamping Het Twiskerveld
description: Friendly, well maintained campground combined with a farm. Lawns with numbered places. Just far enough away from motorway for noise to be not disturbing. Good starting point for bicycle tours to Hoorn and Medemblik. Rental bikes can be delivered on site. Washing machine, dryer, general room, kitchen. Fee includes electricity and hot water. ‚Ç¨ 17.50 (2 adults, camper). Cash payment only. Open mid-April through September.

name: Camping Veerhof
description:
Normally open from April to October, but temporarily closed when we visited mid-April. Unclear when it reopens. Phone numbers: +31 229 201 575, +31 640 109 281, +31 680 115 102.

This campground belongs to the Dutch Nature Campgrounds Chain (Natuurkampeerterreinen - www.natuurkampeerterreinen.nl). Campgrounds of this chain have basic, but well maintained ablutions and are usually situated in a nature area. It is required to buy a EUR 15 membership card that is valid for a year and can be used for all 133 campgrounds in the Netherlands.¬†

name: Museum de Cruquius car park
description:
Level, gravel car park behind the museum. No parking restrictions displayed. A little noise from the main road but all quiet at night. 

#340 bus stops outside the museum and takes about 15 minutes to get into Haarlem. 

Don‚Äôt miss an evening stroll down the canal path to the windmill.

name: Car Park - Sports Centre
description: Large car park next to a sports centre and canal. A few other campers parked here. Seems less busy than another parking spot a few hundred metres further west. Ideal for visiting the Friday cheese market. Easy to get into town if you have a bike, otherwise drive a little closer to centre. Lots of free on-street parking about 1km from the market.

name: Delft
description: Top spot next to canal. Residential but within 1k walk of town centre. When you‚Äôre done with the tourist thing in town; take your bbq into the park next door and a bottle of wine for an afternoon of bliss by the lake üòÄ

name: Near Kinderdijk
description: Small car park next to tennis courts, canal and a few windmills. We stayed at a weekend and it was empty.  Very peaceful spot and perfect to visit the UNESCO site 5km away.

name: Kattendijke
description: Quiet car park near nice village and over looking Zeelandbrug in the distance. Perfect for 1 night. Picnic table included.

name: Zuiderzeemuseum
description: Large open air museum with much living history that gives an excellent impression of life around the Zuiderzee/IJsselmeer in the past. The main museum entrance is outside Enkhuizen where you can park at a flat daily rate. A free boat will take you to the museum from there. From the town entrance of the museum you walk in 5 minutes to the center without parking issues.

name: HelloTwello
description: Very well maintained, quiet campground near the IJssel river and about 4 km from Deventer along a nice road. 7 places with electricity and a lawn. Cash payment only. ‚Ç¨ 17.50 (2 adults, camper). No staff during the day, so calling ahead is recommended (+31 571 298 939).

name: Natuurkampeerterrein Borger
description:
Quiet environment. Grass fields surrounded by woods operated by the Dutch State Forestry Authority. Nice playing oportunities for children. Places have to be paid through a vending machine (card payments only), no permanent staff. Well maintained, new ablutions. Common campfire in the evening.

This campground belongs to the Dutch Nature Campgrounds Chain (Natuurkampeerterreinen - www.natuurkampeerterreinen.nl). Campgrounds of this chain have basic, but well maintained ablutions and are usually situated in a nature area. It is required to buy a EUR 15 membership card that is valid for a year and can be used for all 133 campgrounds in the Netherlands.¬†
fee= ‚Ç¨ 20.30 (2 adults, camper)

name: yerseke
description: a big parking lot for 12 vehicles. close to village with supermarket and a yacht harbour.

name: Parking Spot
description: Great place for an overnight. Very quiet and just a small walk to town.

name: Het Kleine VeltHuis
description: Very nice campsite. Ronald, the owner, spent a year on a beach in Portugal before starting this campsite. Very nice guy, as a former landrover owner, he likes 4x4 and big rigs

name: Ferry Camp
description: Very nice little campsite next to the ferry. 18‚Ç¨ p/n

name: Recreatiecentrum De Kluft
description: Beautiful campground for travellers  by road vehicles as well as by boats. The campsite is located in the Weerribben, the largest swamp area in northwest Europe. Alsmost all pitches have view on one of the canals. Excellent ablutions (with an amazing section for children) and an advanced hot water supply system we haven't see anywhere else. On short walking distance from nature trails and a trail for children as well as bicycle, canoe and  electrical motorboat rental. Laundry, shop, recreation room and swimming facility. Fee 21.70 (2 adults, camper).

name: NIVON Campground Morgenrood
description: The campsite is managed by Nature Friends International. It is a basic campsite consisting of small fields in the forest. Walks in the forest and along ponds can be made immediately around it. Fee ‚Ç¨ 19.80 (2 persons, camper).

name: Camping Zeeburg
description:
Popular and well-managed place with all the amenities. Fast wifi, restaurant, bar, store, etc. 
Feels like a youth hostel with lots of activity. If you like the smell of ganja, you'll love it here.

name: Minicamping de Swaenebloem
description: Farm camp site with wifi, showers, etc. Camping on grass with electric available. Nice, quiet place. 20 euros

name: Gouda City parking
description: Paved parking lot only a few steps from the city center. Many campers. 8 euros for 24 hours, including free electric. Sunday is free, so arrive Saturday and stay until Monday for 8 euros. Dump station and water.  Library with wifi, restroom and cafe at end of parking lot. Really nice town - Saturday market buzzes all day. Tourists' cheese market on Thursday, but you can get the same stuff at Saturday market or at normal shops in town.

name: Ut paradeske
description: Small campsite between Goirle and the Belgium border, they also have one cabin for rent. Only open from April to October. Fee for 2 adults with camper, tent or caravan between EUR 19.50 and EUR 23.50 depending on season.

name: Bird lookout cabin
description: Bird lookout cabin in a beautiful nature reserve

name: Safaripark Beekse Bergen
description:
You can enter with your own car, walk, take the bus or a boat. Its also possible to spend the night on the campsite, cabins or the resort.
Prices are: 26‚Ç¨ per Adult and 9,50‚Ç¨ for Parking

-ADMIN NOTE-
The park does not allow cars with roof racks on the Safari. Bear that in mind when visiting with your Overland Rig.

name: Minicamping Pietershoek
description: Small and quiet campsite just south of Tilburg in the countryside, also 2 cabins available. Fee for 2 persons with accommodation about EUR 20.

name: Route 58
description: Not an official dealer but garage specialised in Landrover, nice people and good service

name: Ancient burial sites
description: Ancient burial sites (1700 - 1000 BC), one of eight, not particular interesting but in a beautiful nature reserve

name: Camperplaats Maastricht
description: Gravel RV parking pads (15‚Ç¨) with free WiFi, pay extra for electric and water.

name: De Eikeboom
description: Small, basic campground, 2 fields surrounded by trees. Close to river and noisy highway. Fee is ‚Ç¨ 18 (2 adults, camper), extra fee for electricity, shower, hot dish washing water.

name: Bergen op Zoom Binnenschelde
description: Parking lot at city beach with designated RV parking. Staying allowed up to 72 hours. Beautiful view, quiet at night.

name: Het Veerse Gat
description:
Onlangs a few places for campers but one of the best spots in the island.
Watch out campers limited to 3.5tons!

name: Gaasper Camping Amsterdam
description: Nice place, 29‚Ç¨ for two people with campervan. Can bicycle 30 minutes to center. easy to go.

name: Landgoed Energy Up
description:
Welcome to Landgoed Energy Up, 
The ultimate destination to recharge amidst nature. I am thrilled to share a bit about our camping and wild camping experiences here at Landgoed Energy Up, especially for those of you exploring the world with your campers and seeking a serene spot to rest.
Nestled in a lush green setting, our estate offers unique accommodations such as yurts, ecoshells, tipis, and other one-of-a-kind lodging options. Our mission is simple but powerful ‚Äì we aim to send our guests home with more energy than they arrived with. To ensure you get the most out of your stay, we recommend a minimum two-night stay for the ultimate experience.
At our estate, you can immerse yourself in a variety of activities. Explore the stunning natural areas surrounding our property with invigorating hikes, or find inner peace through relaxing yoga classes. Additionally, we regularly host special events like sound bowl and cacao ceremonies, along with other unique activities to enhance your visit.
So, whether you're looking for a tranquil camping experience or the thrill of wild camping, Landgoed Energy Up welcomes you to rejuvenate, reconnect, and rediscover the beauty of nature. We can't wait to host you on your next adventure!
Warm regards,
Jochem van Hessen
Owner, Landgoed Energy Up

name: Landcruiser specialist Wheels Unlimited
description:
Rocco is (one of) the most knowledgable Landcruiser specialist around. An avid offroader himself, he truly knows these cars in and out. He has an attic full of second hand spare parts or can order the parts you need. 
He's usually open Monday-Saturday 9-5. 
Address: Oude Waag 34b, Beesd
Phone: +31 345 684 755
Email: info.wheelsunlimited@gmail.com

name: Hostel de Mafkees
description:
Hostel De Mafkees welcomes you. 
If you‚Äôre looking for budget accommodation within walking distance from the Rotterdam city centre and train station: look no further. You just stumbled across one of the biggest and cheapest hostels in town.
Being big doesn‚Äôt just mean we offer lots of beds ‚Äì which we do. On top of that however, we  offer a spacious building with lots of features to keep yourself busy on those rainy days. Chill out in our comfy couches, grab a beer at our bar, shoot some pool: it‚Äôs all there.

name: Camper Park Zwarte Haan
description: Twenty camper spots. Trees for shade and windblock. Each place has grass to sit and gravel to park on. ‚Ç¨ 10 per vehicle per night. Free WiFi, electricity, water and dump. Very quiet.

name: Shipping to Rotterdam info
description:
In August/September 2018 we shipped our car from Montevideo, Uruguay to Rotterdam, The Netherlands. It was way more difficult then shipping the Darien Gap and we feel like we were not prepared enough. 

If you want info about shipping to Rotterdam, feel free to contact Thijs at +31 6 48 58 20 47 because we want to help other people going through the same struggle!

name: Camperspot de kreek
description:
Camperspot for 4 campers.
Quiet and beautiful.

name: Buitenhof Hilvarenbeek
description: Beautiful and cozy campground. Friendly owner and great facilities. There is a kitchen with everything you need and a living-room with great wifi. On this date we paid 15‚Ç¨ for a tent, 2 adults and 2 motorcycles. Not big rig friendly but great for vans and small trailers. The village is less than 1 km away with a market and restaurants. Highly recommended!

name: camping De Lachende Loods
description: small quiet campground with lots of space; nice people who speak english, german and french

name: Camping de Markies
description: Good and simple campground 2 k to super market

name: Veere parkingspot
description: It is a free parking spot close to the historical village Veere. There is a spot for campers and a toilet.

name: Vuurtoren Texel
description: Parking spot near the beach and lighthouse. Restaurant nearby. Quiet, spacious, trash containers. Texel Parking Fee.

name: Zandvoort beach
description:
15 camper park spot, on the boulevard with sea view. 
01 jan	-	28 feb	 	 	EUR	15,00
01 mrt	-	01 okt	 	 	EUR	22,00
02 okt	-	31 dec	 	 	EUR	15,00

The owner comes around in the afternoon to collect the money, he has ID. 
You are allowed to use the facillities of the campsite on the otherside of the road 'camping de Duinrand'.
2km - centrum 
10mtr - beach
600mtr- circuit Zandvoort

When the weather is good, chances are it's full.

name: Kozakkenhaven
description: 10 x large camper spot. 10e a night + tourist tax. fishing spot. next to harbour. next to windmill. playground. very very quite in winter.

name: Rouvoet Motoren - motorcycle mechanic and dealer
description:
Highly recommended all-round motorcycle mechanic for all brands. Vincent (owner) and team are very knowledgeable mechanics. Speaks English and German as well. In MC low-season they even do car maintenance.

Vincent serviced and repaired our Husqvarna's professionally and for a fair price.

name: landgoed de hazenbos
description: nice little campground in a small forest

name: Simonehoeve
description: free parking space in front of a cheese maker and wooden shoes maker

name: linschoten sportfacility
description: quiet parking on gravel in residential area next to soccerfield. perfect for one night. no facilities. supermarket 250 m

name: Bush camp
description: Nice place to have lunch or just rest or stay for a night even tough it's not permitted to wild camp in the Netherlands

name: Laundry automatic
description: 24/7 laundry automatic next to Tinq fuel station

name: Mini Camping De Schildpad
description: Beautiful, small Campsite with animals like Chicken and turtles. Everything arranged with care. Clean washrooms. Possibility to get wood from the owner for making a fire. Fridge with cold softdrinks, beer and wine. Campsite is managed by a nice, older couple.

name: sas van gent
description: A beautiful spot next to the water. Here you can see ships passing by. The underground is grass.

name: Official camper parking - 2 spots - for free
description: On this parkinglot (in the village Bathman) next to sportfields and a cementary are 2 spots available especially for campers. So it's legal to spend the night here, for free, max 2 nights. Quiet. From here it's a nice bicycle trip, 10 km, along the IJssel river, to the beautiful town of Deventer.

name: Huyundai van Riel
description: Mainly Huyundai but repairs all brands. Ask for Peter, he‚Äôll find a solution for your problem. That‚Äôs for sure!!

name: Paterswoldsemeer
description: A nice parking space close to a restaurant and lake. Official space for 6 camper vans and a lot un official places

name: Camping de Bosrand
description:
Quiet campground.
Free shower and water.
No traffic sounds, very peaceful.
The owner is very friendly and the year round visitors are also very friendly. 
There are some children playing on the playground in the front, but in the back where you can camp it's very quiet. 
No swimming pool. Small informal diner where you can order fries, snacks. and ice cream.

name: Vlagberg Naturecamping
description:
Lovely Campside in the woods. Very Spacious and almost like Wild-Camping You can pick a slot with Power or without. Dogs allowed. 
Camper 6‚Ç¨
an 6‚Ç¨ per additional Person

name: Stadscamping Deventer
description: Small very informal camping right next to a river. Possibility to cross the river with a little ferry for ‚Ç¨1 and walk into city center of Deventer. Clean toilets and showers.

name: Camping De Zeeuwse Vlag
description: minicamping, paid 20‚Ç¨ for 2 people, 1 tent and 1 Car (or equals 2 motorbikes), shower costs 0,50‚Ç¨ per 6 minutes. everything clean and calm. friendly hostfamily

name: camping de Lindenhof
description: nice quiet campsite with basic amenities.

name: Natuur Camping De Hoevens
description: This nature campsite offers good space, sites around a big grassy field with a fireplace in the middle, a swimming dam, locally made beer from reception and the quietness I was looking for. Its 10 EUR per night for a trekking site for small tents, clean toilets, free wifi, small kitchen you can use to cook something or heat a canned meal from the honesty grocery store (noodle soup and tinned beanstew). Nice setting in the forest and very calm atmosphere

name: Official free camping spot Berg aan de Maas
description:
Gravel parking lot next to the river Maas. Little ferry crossing the river to Belgium. Free. Next to houses, so please respect this area and clean up your rubbish! Nice lunch room accross the road. 

We live close by and are willing to help fellow travelers with any issues. Just send us a message via the contact form on our website.

name: Zonnemaire
description: Idyllic, very quiet site. Space for max 1 tent. You have to cross the damm and find your way to some bushes to get there.

name: Camping Oostpoort
description: Nice and simple campsite 15‚Ç¨ for a camper and 2 persons. Run by the local soccer club. Grassy area, when wet you may get stuck. Good place for big rigs. Fontana Spa resort, supermarket and restaurant at walking distance in the village.

name: Workum Harbor Parking
description: Big parking lot with toilet and shower block. Showers only open in daytime. All for free:-) Very nice small village with brick houses. DAY USE ONLY

name: Hof Van Axel
description: Small campground next to the farmer house. Many different animals sleep next to you:-) Everything clean and well maintained. Friendly owner! 11.60Euro/night (2+van+dog).

name: Dairy farm ‚ÄúJachtlust‚Äù
description: Camping on a dairy farm. Nice people, we paid 18.50‚Ç¨, clean showers toilets. Good wifi, restaurants nearby on walking distance. Big rigs will fit.

name: Camperplaats Hulst
description: Campground specifically for motorhomes. Located remotely from the city of Hulst. Very quiet. Very well maintained. Grassy area with showers (coin driven) and toilet. Prices ‚Ç¨15,- per night per site including electricity. Room for about 20 motorhomes. Dump station on site. Filling up your fresh water tank needs to be paid for extra. Free open WiFi.

name: Camping de Kleine Heerlijkheid
description: A small camping area in the countryside. Very helpful and friendly owners. Only showers and toilets etc. Not very expensive. Zuidlaardermeer (lake) across the road

name: Noorderloo
description:
Very nice and quiet campsite with little lake in beautiful wood. Good facilities and vegetarian/vegan restaurant.
20 euro pp.

Very good campsite. Modern and well kept facilities, quiet and clean. Friendly staff. Price depends on high/low season, and type of pitch. Electricity and water tap at every pitch and included in the price. All pitches are quite spacey, but the pitches in the part called 'EIkenhof' are the biggest and most expensive, though still only about ‚Ç¨ 20 per night.
Showers are very new and clean, but scorching hot at first and only luke warm after that. 
Very nice (though small) forest and beautiful small lake for swimming or relaxing next to.
Wifi available for free at all pitches. Very fast!

name: Well
description: Small campsite near a small ‚Äúbeach‚Äù of a small lake Seurenheide, near the river de Maas. Quiet friendly place. From there you can make nice walks in National Parc Maasduinen and visit picturesque small towns in northern Limburg and Germany

name: Zorn hotel Duinlust
description: 3 star hotel with super friendly owner and his son. Charge 75/85 euro standard twin bedroom. I ask for first storey bedroom and was granted without incresed price. BF included.

name: River side
description: This is a nice site for a night or two, views of the city lights at night are beautiful. Quiet spot of the main roads but super close to the city. It‚Äôs a service road for the power lines directly above the site. Little house boats nearby. Some walkers and runners along the bank but everyone was friendly and happy to see us chilling out.

name: Minicamping d'n Dikkenberg
description: Small camping on the edge of a national park. 12 places for campers, cars etc. Friendly owners. Downside: just 1 toilet and shower for women, just 1 toilet and shower for men.

name: Boerderijcamping Schrouff Vijlen
description: A small camping at a farm. The cows are walking on the other side of the electric fence. Clean toilets and showers. Bring your own toilet paler. There is WiFi, but not unlimited. Friendly owner. Nice view of the Vaalserberg (highest point of the Netherlands).

name: Cafe Belgie
description: Nice small pub with Belgian beers on tap. In summertime they have a nice terrace along the waterside.

name: Castle Twickel
description: Huge castle dating from the year 1347. Loads of walking trails in the area.

name: The Bels Watermill
description:
Nice old watermill open to visit for free. There is also a restaurant for local dishes in this place. There are lot of walking trails in the beautiful area.  

We didn't stay overnight but in front of the watermill also a big parking is found, probably staying overnight in a campervan should be no problem.

name: Pole camping site "The shot"
description: Small pole campground, usually not busy.  Water by hand pump available (only in summer)

name: Parkweg Harderwijk
description: Free camperspot. Max 3 vehicles, max two nights.

name: Hoek van Holland
description: Free camperplace for Five campers at the Nieuwe waterweg,koningin Emma boulevard,Nice vieuws and quiet at Night.

name: Enkhuizen
description: Next to a harbour 6x campsite For camper. Max 48 Horus. Parking fee per 24h: ‚Ç¨ 11,15

name: Maasheggen
description:
Nice green area with walking trails.
No facilities

name: Outdoors Holten
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been iOverlander verified.

By Owner:
Outdoors Holten offers special overnight stays. In addition to our Scandinavian Lodges and Safari Tents, we have a number of camping and camper-only places. Beautifully situated in spacious places.

Children and pets are also welcome on our 14ha estate. They can romp around in the woods.

There is a sanitary unit on the campsite with separate areas, showers, washbasins and the option of emptying your chemical toilet.
You are allowed to barbecue yourself (only gas). Coals are not allowed because of the wooded area.

We are close to the A1 highway, so also ideal if you are passing through to or from Germany.

For bikers, cyclists and hikers we have a separate site. 

Outdoors Holten has new owners since March 2020. Kim & Arjan. 
We cycled the last 1,5 year from Alaska to Patagonia and used iOverlander a lot. We are happy we can now add our own place to stay :-)

See you at Outdoors. We‚Äôre looking forward to meet new overlanders.

name: Camperplaats Almelo
description: Campervans only. Close to town centre. ‚Ç¨8,50 p/night

name: Bemmel
description:
Mixer parking lot for cars and campers
Near a beautifull riverside and near to the village

name: Riverside campsite
description: Wildecamping next to the river. Good 4G, great place

name: In de polders
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: iOverlander does not support any illegal camping. Please check local and country laws. Netherlands is known for in general not allowing wild camping.

Dead end road so perfect to park for a night. No traffic during the night. In the morning some hikers for the near windmill.

name: Onlanden small parking lot
description: Small gravel parking place. Great views on the country side. It is the parking for the watch tower (nice walk up) during day time some people at night quite.

name: d√§√∂lkesberg
description: quit spot, next to little church with picknick benches.

name: Garage Oirschot B.V.
description:
Highly recommended workshop.
Super professional and friendly team.
Specialized in VW, AUDI, SEAT, SKODA but will do other brands as well. We got our 91‚Äò VW syncro fixed here. We popped in spontaneous, as you would when you have a problem. They ordered the part that afternoon and started to work on our car the next morning. 
Nice campground nearby (only 2km away).

name: Ravenstein, next to the ferry house
description:
Great place for day recreation on the Maas. Paved terrain.
--
Prima plek voor dagrecreatie aan de Maas. Verhard terrein.

name: p+r Ede-wageningen
description: Spot at the parking place next to the railway station of Ede-Wageningen. The place is very quiet in the evening. You can stand next to the bushes

name: Free camp Huinerenkweg 14
description: Nice free spot for campers, you are invited to put a fee in a red postal box

name: Camping & Gastenverblijf De Brembroeken
description:
18 spacious spots with sanitary building options for disposal of chemical toilet and water tap

18 ruime plaatsen met sanitairgebouw mogelijkheden voor storten van chemisch toilet en watertappunt

name: No100 great place to eat and have a drink
description: A piece of pure Dutch nature. Terrace on the canal great place to stop for a drink

name: Parking Aquacenter Apeldoorn
description: Official parking place for 4 campers. The spot is at the very end of a huge parking area. No toilet or bathroom. The Swimmingpool nearby (opens 9am) has a toilet and you can take a shower there when you have a bathing suit. I don't know the price. Relatively quiet, some parkers leave around 11 pm.

name: Parking lot
description:
A sign says overnight stay for camper vans is allowed for 2x24h. 
Totally quiet, ok for one night. Gas station around the corner.

name: Marnemoende camper place
description: Camper place on the river side. This place is combined with a restaurant and harbour. Facilities are clean

name: Mountain Oak
description:
Amazing campsite with great grounds, facilities, extremely friendly owners, biker friendly.

Nice views of the horses on the farm and there is a lake nearby for swimming.

name: Minicamping en Kampeerboerderij Molenbroek
description:
Nice little campsite with a section for tents, park up the bikes right next to them.
Owners are fantastic, I have had issues in Netherlands with a hammock setup as some spots refuse but this is one where they made an effort to sort me out. 
Facilities are good and the shops are close by.

name: Volkswagen Kever Centrum
description:
These guys repair any car, but are specialist in volkswagen oldtimers. They repair VW campers, vocho (kever, Beetle ) if your traveling with a Volkswagen these are your guys. 

If you have any other issue during traveling it think these guys can help!

name: Dijkgatbos
description: A spaciously set up parking area just off the main road. An official mountain bike route and hiking routes start off this location (see pictures). No facilities, such as bathrooms or showers, nor is there electricity provided (a nearby campsite just one exit down the road does provide this), but great for a short stay away from modern day conveniences. Not officially a campsite, therefore very much wild camping, but perfectly suitable!

name: Ervo De KoekKoek
description: Nice quiet little campsite. Fridge with beers, all amenities and easy going.

name: Beach car park
description:
Really nice car park right by the ocean‚Äôs beach. Overnight stay in a vehicle is tolerated. Lots of camper vans around. 
Tenting is not a good idea, it would be provocative. 
Plenty of space. Also other car parks in the surrounding area. Choose your favorite. 
There was a toilet building which was unfortunately closed for some reason when we were there.

name: Nieuwe Mouscou
description:
Great campsite with all the amenities and a swimming pool. Buffet breakfast available.

There is also a nudist section if you are in to that.

name: Natuurkampeerterrein de Knotwilg
description: Camping at the polders, big rig friendly, nice place next to the water, amidst a natural reserve.

name: Next to a small pond
description: It is a gravel parking spot along a very small road. It seems only locals drive it.

name: RV4WD Land Cruiser specialist
description: RV4WD is well-known in the Dutch Land Cruiser community. They do repairs, sell parts and accesories (Terrain Tamer dealer) and know a lot about overlandiing from experience. Also sell second-hand Land Cruisers. They did a good job twice on my Land Cruiser. More info: https://www.rv4wd.nl/contact-2/.

name: Lonnekeres Overland en camperplaats
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified. 
---
Lonnekeres Overland en camperplaats is a small and nice place located in the Netherlands Nest the German border. 
Please check www.lonnekeres.nl for more Information.

name: it Dreaml√¢n
description: Simple, small, grassy, friendly nature campground with a great view over the countryside. Well maintained. Good starting point for cycle tours around the Lauwersmeer. Washing machines, bicycle rental. Eur 23 per night (2 adults, campervan, power). Wifi near the reception building.

name: Spot at the Lake
description: Beautiful spot at the water, no people around

name: Autobedrijf Kooistra
description: Mechanic serving all brands. Two people were available immediately to help us with an issue with one of our seats. Solved efficiently and at reasonable costs. I would definitely trust them for larger repairs.

name: De Oude Trambrug
description: Small farm campground. Spacious sites, luxury well maintained ablutions. Washing machine and dryer. Meals served on request. Choose between a field with wind protection and a nice view. Fee EUR 21.50 (2 adults, campervan, power).

name: de Skuorre
description: Simple but friendly and adequately equipped farm campsite within 10 minutes walking from Franeker. Grassy sites with some wind protection. Wifi near entrance. EUR 16 (2 adults, campervan, power).In Franeker you find the oldest planetarium in the world.

name: De Wetterp√¥lle
description: Basic campground surrounded by car dealership, yacht harbour and DIY store. Large grass plain. No reception on site, pay at Peugeot car dealership. Fee EUR 17 (2 adults, campervan, power)

name: De Huttert
description:
Campsite with toilet shower and washing machine. 
Under heavy rain they brought us inside so we did not have to stay in the tent.

name: Grass Patch
description:
Small grass patch next to a dirt road
Easily accessible via 200m of dirt road

name: Auto Connections/4x4 Center
description: If you're looking for a roof or camper conversion don't go here. Sloppy work, too many mistakes and a total lack of communication with the owners.

name: Motor Service Zuid (MSZ)
description:
All round motor service. Repairs & maintenance.
Confident guy, professional and not expensive. 
Parking in front of the shop and nice coffee..
Recommended !!!

name: Legal camper spot on parking
description:
Legal camper spot for max 3 vehicles. 

City center is across the road where you find shops, restaurants, supermarkets etc..

name: Heegermeer
description: Nice parking spot next to Hegermeer with perfect view over the lake

name: Tamoil
description: Near intersection North-South and West-East

name: Liessel
description:
Nice spot near the water. Very  quiet. Possibility to make a campfire.
3 places.

name: Albert Heijn
description: Medium sized supermarket with a good selection of vegetables and bread. ATM inside the store.

name: Godfried de Vocht
description: Large bakery with a good selection of bread and pastry. Also possible to drink  a coffee with cake.

name: Lidl
description: Good range of groceries and fresh bread. Smaller product range than Albert Heijn, but lower prices.

name: Biesbosch
description: Free toilets, paid showers and water faucet

name: quite hill spot
description:
nice quiet spot to relax, very nice view.
with a garbage can so please keep it clean.

name: Camp Boerhoes
description: Nice farmer campground near the river Vechte.

name: Zoetermeer
description: Notice it is a wild camper site. But it is a place near end end off road with no passing cars.

name: Garage with tools and a nice cup of coffee
description:
Are you with your motorcycle heading for a long roadtrip and you need a little fix for your bike? Or you want a place to sleep?

Hit me up! You can use my tools and garage for free!
Just sent me a email; Greeko@live.nl

name: Natuurgebied Plaat van de Vliet
description: Official camper spot. Place for 4 campers. Next to the n257, so some noise. Beautiful quiet place with a lot of space. Between the modern windmills.

name: Heerenveen
description: In Easter skar, a nature area, near Heerenveen. A parking place, with no facilities, except a picnic table

name: SportLandgoed
description: Spacious, grassy campground next to a fishing pond. Swimming not allowed. Basic, but clean and well maintained ablutions. Near beautiful nature, good for cycling and walking. Dish washing facilities. Good 4G connection. WiFi near reception building.

name: Camping Stadspark
description: Grassy terrain, partly under high trees. About 3km walking/cycling to town centre, mainly through the park. Basic, clean, well maintained ablutions. Wifi across a better part of the park. Good GSM. To protect the grass many sites were unavailable. Relatively few sites with electricity.

name: Venlo
description: Motor Center Venlo, repairs motorcycles and parts available.

name: Fort Asperen
description: This is a parking lot near Fort Asperen. There are no 'no camping' signs. Free. Beautiful surrounding between fruit trees and the quiet river Linge.

name: Echteld
description:
At little lake. Nice and quiet place. Possibility to swim.
Can be soggy....

name: De Vrolijk
description: Nature campsite, with swimming fishing pond.

name: Gerardus hoeve
description: Luxery restaurant with exceptional view over the valley. Great place to stop for lunch or just a cup of coffee

name: Voncken
description:
Camping at the farm. Beautiful view of the hill country.

Kamperen bij de boer. Prachtig uitzicht op het heuvelland

name: Motorcamping bij het Vuur ('by the fire')
description:
Motorbikes ONLY, no exceptions. Our camping area has 25 spots to put up your tent, 10 power (220V) and water points. There are showers and multiple toilets available
.....
[dutch]
Onze camping bestaat uit 25 offici√´le plaatsen, en er zijn 10 stroom en waterpunten op het terrein. Het sanitair is onder de grote kapschuur. Er zijn drie douches, en verder drie toiletten en wat mannen plasbakken.

[english]
Our camping has 25 spots to put up your tent, 10 power (220V) and water points. There are showers and multiple toilets available.

name: V-P Motorsport
description: In case of troubles with you're motorbike, here is a place where they can help you. Motorbike ONLY! Open from Theusday till Friday 09:00 till 17:00. Saturday morning's only.

name: Near Grave
description: Paved parking area for self contained motorhomes. Dump station. The lot has about 50 spaces for cars, but only 5 marked for motorhome use. Lot is empty on weekends, but busy during the week.

name: Roadside Pulloff
description: Roadside pulloff by canal. Busy with cyclists during the day, but nice and quiet overnight. Probably room for three or four vans. No services, just a nice overnight spot.

name: Big quiet parking lot
description: I honestly can't believe this isn't already listed. Nothing saying you can't overnight here. A big lot. Nobody else around. Great access to cycling paths along the canal. No services, and no trash containers. Please don't leave anything behind.

name: Parking lot by a sports field
description: Nothing special, just a little used parking lot by a sports field. Fine for an overnight spot for self contained motorhomes.

name: Camping de Toekomst
description: Green camping, always a good spot for travelers

name: Huizen
description: 8 sites for overnight motorhome parking only. 48 hour maximum. In July, they tend to fill up by just after lunch, so best time to get a site is probably 11am or so.

name: Minicamping De Hanze
description: Very friendly farm campground. The first thing that happened when we arrived is that we were offered coffee. Large lawn surrounded by trees. Nice cycling trip through the forest to the small but beautiful Hanse town Elburg.

name: Erve Wolkotte
description:
Korenmorsweg 7.
Spacious well-kept grassy campground at a (former) farm. No frills, but clean showers, electricity and WiFi. Indoor fireplace and outdoor firepit. Small playground for children. Quiet and green surroundings.

name: under the bridge
description:
Not official. Stay on good luck.
Near the road. Good shelter. Next to the river.

name: Small parking lot by the dyke.
description: Room for maybe three vehicles. Nice quiet spot for a small van or self contained motorhome. No services. One small trash can.

name: Beside the ferry port road
description: Small lot near the ferry port. A short but steep hill down, but we are 6 meters and made it fine. If you have a long overhang behind the rear wheels it might be a problem.

name: Duurswoldje Campground
description: Really nice little campground. ‚Ç¨8 per night includes electricity and WiFi. Space for maybe 6 motorhomes up to 7 meters. Water and dump available, but no showers or toilets so self contained rigs only.

name: MotoPuro Ducati
description:
Service center for repair and service for your Ducati motorbike. Well skilled mechanics and friendly people. Oh...and very good coffee :-)
https://www.motopuro.nl

name: Camping De Bleek
description: Small family owned camp spot, with separate places for vans and tents. owners are friendly. quite and peaceful, 5 min from town for groceries, etc.

name: Zuidpier van haven van Delfzijl
description: South pier of harbour of Delfzijl. next to the sea. nice view on the dollard. little bit complicated to find.

name: Camping de Kapel
description:
Nice and simple campsite near Valkenswaard. The owners are very friendly and the facilities (like showers and toilets) are clean.

There is a fridge for the hikers and you are allowed to make a campfire.

name: Rijnhaven, Wageningen
description:
Free official campersite, 5 places, no facilities. 
walking distance to the village of Wageningen, known because of WWll and great hiking and cycling.

name: Old Inn restaurant
description:
Old Inn restaurant, Siebengewaldseweg 13	 6595 NX	Ottersum (Limburg). Free campersite, also for big overlanders next to restaurant / bar with a lot of special beers (closed monday). 
No facilities besides restaurant. 
City centre 3 km
In woods, good hiking / cycling.

name: Car park by stadium
description: Free parking all around the stadiums. Cycle into town.

name: Public Parking
description:
Small public parking. A bit noisy because of the highway but very close to city.
Also there are rental bikes and scooters right next to it to bring you easy to the centre of Eindhoven.

name: Parking lot in the forest
description: Small parking lot near a tiny road (no traffic at night. There are several trails for hikers and for dog owners. No services available but good for one night. Please keep the place clean .

name: De Ruyterstraat 39
description:
As overlanders ourselves we wish to give back to the community. We offer free coffee, wifi, laundry,showers and if needed a place to stay. 
Feel free to contact via +31 628789581

name: Camperplaats Kale Duinen
description: Beautiful places for motorhomes near Drents-Friese and Schaopedobbe where you can enjoy beautiful bike paths and hiking trails (maps available). The campsite is equipped with paved areas with grass and electricity. Toilet, shower, running water, sewage system, all-inclusive chemical toilet. Even the supermarket can bring your groceries to your doorstep.

name: Tent in our garden
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   

Cyclists are welcome te set up their tent in our front or back yard. We live on an average busy street in the city of Breda. Our backyard is fenced.

name: Kardinge Sports Centre
description: Official camper parking near sports center and small beach, free drinking water tap.

name: Wijk bij Duurstede
description:
Camping 't Boomgaardje. Minicamping, SVR kamperen bij de boer (camping at a farm).

They have a comfortable recreation room with a kitchen

name: Parking next to fishing spot
description: Reasonably sheltered parking spot next to a small road. Suited for campers, not suited for ground tents

name: Lievelinge
description: Established campground on the water, full amenities and in a forest

name: Retrain gene therapy
description:
Lovely little picnic spot near a small stream walking distance from retranchement 
Good for an overnight stay

name: camper parking place
description: 7 large free camperplaces available. Very close to the visitorscenter of the National park. Electricity available. Quiet place.

name: Maria hoeve
description:
22Ha campsite in the woods were campfires are allowed. You can pick a spot in the woods or find a spot on the field. Nice staff. 
You can order a meal and eat it at your own spot. WiFi only in the ‚Äúwifiwood‚Äù part of the campsite the rest is pure nature.

name: Hof Camping Caf√© in den
description: THE NICEST PARTY LOCATION IN HEERLEN AND SURROUNDINGS. A UNIQUE CAMPSITE AND GROUP ACCOMMODATION FOR YOUNG AND OLD TO SPEND THE NIGHT. IN THE EVENING AN ATMOSPHERIC CAF√â WHERE YOU CAN ENJOY A NICE BEER AND A DELICIOUS BURGER

name: Next to the firefighters and Eem
description: Nice place next to river the Eem, very close to old inner city of Amersfoort and next to the new part. Electricity and water available. 3 times 24 hours is allowed. We didn‚Äôt stay here but we live in Amersfoort and saw this spot isn‚Äôt on iOverlander

name: Camper plaats Crumpse Hoekje
description: Very well-maintained campsite.  Part grass, part gravel.  Price without electricity 12.00 euro for 2 persons.  Close to the Rhine and German border.

name: Camping Kleinbaest
description: Small campsite with wide views over de the meadows. Max 12 spots. Very friendly owners.

name: Camping Schouteveld
description:
Little campplace in the woods. Be aware last 2 km is a bicycle pathe so be kind to your fellow humans.
Nice and quiet.
I added big trucks, farmers equipment drives over the path.

name: Gasflesvulstation.nl
description:
Primagaz, Benegas, Antargaz, Rijngas, Campinggaz.
Fillingstation and Sales see Link
https://www.gasflesvulstation.nl

name: Vakantiewereld
description: Camping Store.  Assortment of camping/ outdoors articles. Parts for campers

name: Zandvoort beach parking
description:
Wild camping spot at Zandvoort beach, amazing view at the sea & beach!

A bit further is a camper parking place especially for big campers. This parking area allows to sleep at the parking area for max. 3 days if your campervan is self-sufficient.

Parking is free from 22.00 until 8.00. During the day 2,50 euros per hour or 15 euros for the whole day.

We arrived after 20.00 and there was enough space and many other campervans.

name: Plompe toren
description: Nice and quiet, with views on the sea and grasslands. Tower nearby. Picnic table and plenty space to park, also for big rigs

name: ‚Äòt Oppertje
description: The campsite is next to a National Park and a little lake. They have different pitches where you can stay and have all the facilities on side. The access is ok it is single road. Owner‚Äôs are very friendly and helpful.

name: Bieschbos dead end
description: Dead end around a bend (so hidden from road) next to the water

name: Linne
description: Nice spot along the river Maas, near the village Linne. Quiet place. Many fishermen. No services.

name: Buytenplaets Abelen
description: Small quirky campsite in a nice small village.  The camp owner is very friendly and helpfull he made sure I could charge my phone and let me use a small kitchen and table near my tent. ‚Ç¨8 for 1 person and a tent great value and a lovey spot

name: the Bedroom car park
description: Car park at the end of a quiet industrial estate next to the beach. Handy for ferries.

name: Camping De Lambrechtshoeve
description: Medium sized and lots of space at this campsite.  Quiet behind a farm.  Also suitable for motorhomes and caravans with the motorbike and your tent.  Good WiFi.  At your place only electricity but no water.  Well in the sanitary building.

name: Minicamping de Klaverhoeve
description: Nice and quiet place to stay, there's a little barn with chickens, goats, pigs and rabbits. On the camping field, there are a few guinea fowl walking around.

name: Tilburg
description:
this spot is near the ‚ÄúLange Jan‚Äù small lake. It it not very big at the parking. Just one truck. But in the surroundings you can find more spots.

Watch out for the bridges hight. Use you‚Äôre map for different initiaries‚Ä¶

Calm at night, 

Please make sure to keep the place clean. The Netherlands are not easy for wild camping. If we make a mess off it‚Ä¶ they will definitely put some ‚Äúforbidden camping‚Äù bords here‚Ä¶

name: camperplaats P Langweer
description:
Motorhome parking. Can stay for maximum 3 nights. Free. No amenities.
4 camper parking spaces.

name: Boerderij Camping Beckers
description: This is a small quiet farming site, set amongst the old farm orchards.  The campsite has about 25 camping places

name: Small Campingsite in Naturereserve
description: beautiful campground next to many rivers, sheeps and cows, it's in the middle of a nature reserve. It's a small campsite with two showers and two toilets you can stay here for around 13‚Ç¨

name: small clearance in the forest
description:
small clearance in the forest,  completely out of sight.

place for 1 or 2 tents, unacessible by car.

we hear the road just door but very quiet.

name: 't Zinkviooltje
description: Beautiful campsite with a nice view on a hill and with all the amenities you need.

name: small hidden way in walking area
description:
it's a small trail in the walking area, normally quiet between 20pm and 8am.

the trail is hidden among trees.

road access by walking way so just accesible for bicycle and bike.

3 or 4 places for tents.

name: De Pimpernoot
description:
Cute little campspot for trekkers for up to 5 tents and one shelter. Cold shower and toilet is available, so is sink and electricity to charge up devices.
Just 5 ‚Ç¨ per night. Owner Monique checks in every day,  making sure all is well.

name: Among trees
description:
Around 50m near the walking trail, you can go among trees and find places for tent, out of sight. you also can park your bike with you. there is the road on the opposite side but nothing annoying.

just the walking dogs can come to see you.

name: Amsterdam
description: Big carpark! No restrictions, easy access.

name: De Veenkuil natuurkampeerterrein
description: Natural place nearby a lake. Good facillities and relaxing surroundings.

name: Lismarq Base Camp
description:
Place for world travelers traveling in an expedition vehicle. Agelo is a very small quiet village. So if you just want to have a nice quiet spot to spend the night you're welcome. The place is easy to approach with an expedition truck. We don't ask for any money for you to stay. You're our guest. But please leave the place as you found it. 

We are rebuilding the place. At the moment we've got electricity. In the near future, we also can provide water.

name: IBIS Hotel
description: On the outskirts of Tilburg, there is an IBIS hotel with a big parking lot for campers/rigs. The hotel is directly off of the A58 highway, so it's a nice place for a quick stop. Both the port of Antwerp and Rotterdam are about 1.5h away.

name: Camperplaats Kinderdijk
description: Place for campers only. All facilities. Pay what you use. At least 17 euro per night.

name: Op Gen Beukelskoel
description: Lovely, small campsite with beautiful views. The owner is a very friendly, elderly man. There are no defined spots, once you arrive, you can just choose where you want to pitch your tent.

name: De Drie Morgen
description:
Good sanitary facilities with hot and cold water.
90 spacious pitches with 10 amp. power supply, including paved camper pitches. Dogs are welcome. Friendly owners.

name: Van der Vliet
description:
- Propane filling station (ready while you wait)
- Covered storage
Open from Mon. to Sat. from 9:00 - 17:30  (Sat. 17:00)

name: 4WD Techniek, good garage for Landcruisers
description:
It is worth driving up to here. Peter van de Warf really wants to help you.
He knows all Landcruisers inside out.
Of course for reasonable normal prices.
He did a good job for us, helping us out with our gearbox. 
Very friendly. 
Normally every year Peter also gives lectures and workshops for the Landcruiser-club in the Netherlands. 
Try to make an appointment by mail on forehand, as he might be also very busy. info@4wdtechniek.nl
When you visit, say HI! from us. Emiel and Leslie

name: CP Sevenum
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.¬†
-----------
We have a beautiful meadow with an unobstructed view of the church tower of Sevenum and the horse pasture of the neighbors.

It is a 20-minute walk to the center for local restaurants, 700 meters to the supermarket for groceries or delicious fresh sandwiches and 600 meters to the Horst-Sevenum station for a day in Venlo or Eindhoven.
Furthermore, there is a wide possibility of trips to attractions in the area such as the theme park Toverland and Peelbergen Equestrian Centre.

There are also many opportunities here for hikers, cyclists and horse lovers. If you have your own horse and would like to take it with you, it is possible to arrange a place in the stable or pasture in consultation with the neighbors.

So be surprised and book a weekend away in Sevenum!
But also great for a single night if you are passing through. We are a short distance from the A67 and A73.

Perfect for...
Hikers, cyclists and horse lovers


Wij hebben een mooie weide met vrij uitzicht op de kerktoren van Sevenum en de paardenweide van de buren.

Het is 20 minuten wandelen naar het centrum voor de plaatselijke horecagelegenheden, 700 mtr naar de supermarkt voor de dagelijkse boodschappen of lekkere verse broodjes en 600 mtr naar het station Horst-Sevenum voor een dagje Venlo of Eindhoven.
Verder een ruime mogelijkheid van uitstapjes naar attracties in de omgeving zoals het attractiepark Toverland en Peelbergen Equestrian Centre.

Ook voor de wandelaar, fietser en paardenliefhebber zijn hier veel mogelijkheden. Heb je een eigen paard en wil je deze eens meenemen dan bestaat de mogelijkheid om in overleg met de buren een plekje in de stal of weide te regelen.

Dus laat je verrassen en boek een weekendje weg in Sevenum!
Maar ook prima voor een enkele overnachting als je op doorreis bent. Wij liggen op korte afstand van de A67 en A73.

Perfect voor...
Wandelaars, fietsers en paardenliefhebbers

name: CP Sevenum
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.¬†
-----------
We have a beautiful meadow with an unobstructed view of the church tower of Sevenum and the horse pasture of the neighbors.

It is a 20-minute walk to the center for local restaurants, 700 meters to the supermarket for groceries or delicious fresh sandwiches and 600 meters to the Horst-Sevenum station for a day in Venlo or Eindhoven.
Furthermore, there is a wide possibility of trips to attractions in the area such as the theme park Toverland and Peelbergen Equestrian Centre.

So be surprised and book a weekend away in Sevenum!

Perfect for...

Verder een ruime mogelijkheid van uitstapjes naar attracties in de omgeving zoals het attractiepark Toverland en Peelbergen Equestrian Centre.

Ook voor de wandelaar, fietser en paardenliefhebber zijn hier veel mogelijkheden. Heb je een eigen paard en wil je deze eens meenemen dan bestaat de mogelijkheid om in overleg met de buren een plekje in de stal of weide te regelen.

Dus laat je verrassen en boek een weekendje weg in Sevenum!
Maar ook prima voor een enkele overnachting als je op doorreis bent. Wij liggen op korte afstand van de A67 en A73.

Perfect voor...
Wandelaars, fietsers en paardenliefhebbers

name: ruigenhoeh naturkamping
description: great gras ground big places nice reception.in the rear a perfect track for walking and cycing.paid 16‚Ç¨ for one peruson one camper without electricity

name: parking linieweg
description: parking place in front of a sport center.perfect for one night.alone in the night.good walking to the sea

name: Aemstellehoeve
description: Farm campground with some 20 sites. Basic, but well maintained ablutions. Wide view over the meadows. Friendly owners. Dish washing facilities, fridge, playground, shelter. Phone +31 297 582 344.

name: Het Bos Roept!
description: Member of the chain of Natuurkampeerterreinen (membership required - ‚Ç¨16 per year). Very friendly place. Modern, well maintained facilities. Surrounded by forest, but near highway. Communal space with kitchen and heating. Large sites.

name: De Landerij
description: Member of the chain Natuurkampeerterreinen. Membership required (‚Ç¨15.95 per year). Large spaces, dated but clean ablutions. Near nature park De Rottige Meenthe. Washing machine, dish washing facilities, canoes, common room. Phone +31 6 2017 6317.

name: Krukel Minicamp
description: A nice place directly on the sea. Place for 3-5 cars. You must first check in at the Camp office. 7,5‚Ç¨ per night

name: Beside river Ijssel
description: A smal parking lot, 10m beside the river Ijssel. No Infrastructure.

name: near Schoonloo
description: Nice parking space in the woods. No sign that says camping is forbidden. very quiet.

name: MWS Almere motor mechanic expert
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Owner contribution, please check in when using the service to verify. 

Maintenance, overhaul and repair of motorcycles
-Dyno test work
-Diagnosis of injection systems and malfunctions
- Adjustments of carburettors and injection systems
-Delivery, adjustment work and programming PowerCommander on dyno test bench
-Ultrasonic cleaning of carburettors and injectors
-Turning, milling, and welding of, among other things, aluminum.
-Delivery, overhaul and maintenance of shock absorbers and front forks, including Wilbers and Ohlins.
-Delivery of parts and technical accessories.
-No testing and/or repair of Harley-Davidson and mini-bikes
-Delivery of Castrol oil and maintenance products

Onderhoud, revisie- en reparatie van  motorfietsen
-Dyno- testwerk
-Diagnose van injectiesystemen en storingen
-Afstelwerk van carburateurs en injectiesystemen
-Levering,afstelwerk en programmeren PowerCommander op dyno-testbank
-Ultrasoon reinigen van carburateurs en injectors
-Draaiwerk, freeswerk, en laswerk van o.a.aluminium.
-Levering, revisie en onderhoud van schokbrekers en voorvorken, o.a. Wilbers en Ohlins.
-Levering onderdelen en technische accessoires.
-Geen testwerk en/of reparatie van Harley-Davidson en mini-bikes
-Levering Castrol olie en onderhoudsproducten

name: Camperstop B&B De Hammiehoeve
description: Small new camperstop (5 places) and 2 rooms at a family eggfarm. Quiet, surrounded by trees. Excellent quality amenities, washing machine, grey water disposal, erc. At the edge of the town Enschede. NOTE: >3,5T or higher than 2,7m? Approach from the north, due to small bridge. No tents, but overlanders sleeping in their car/van are welcome. Maximum length 10m.

name: Pilootweg parkeerplaats
description: just a simple parking where you could spend the night

name: Dokkum
description: Nice place near the water. Max10 campers.

name: Grave
description: openair washing machines, operateble whit Eurocoins

name: de Snor
description: Nice quite place with grass and a bench with two bins

name: Bloemwijk camping
description: Good camping for cyclists. Very basic facilities. Quiet. Cash only. Paid 50 euros for 2 nights 2 people 2 tents. Showering 50 cent. We were allowed to cook indoors.

name: Beek en Hei
description: Campsite in the woods close to Otterlo. Good location for accessing the National Park De Hoge Veluwe. Cycle tourers do not need to book in advance, they guarantee a place.

name: parking gare Abcoude
description:
Free parking to take the train to Amsterdam

parking gratuit pour prendre le train pour Amsterdam

name: Sittard - Swimming Pool
description: It has 10 camper spots for a length of 9m. You are allowed 48hrs in a week. The spots are nice and wide and the trees in front give nice shade on a warm day.

name: Camping Enkhuizerzand
description: Nice campsite just on the outskirts of the little town. It is on the IJsselmeer so you can have a swim or use your paddleboard. It is a nice little town with a lot of history and definitely worth a visit

name: Hotel Paradiso
description: Studio with kitchenette sitting area twin beds secured parking. Very clean and nice hosts. Close to food shopping and restaurants. I paid ‚Ç¨50/night.

name: Parkeerplaats Kulertseweg, Deurne
description: Parking spots in quiet town next to pretty allotments

name: Free drinking water
description: You are welcome to use our outside tap for filling up yout drinking water supply. Adress is Asserstraat 51 9461GB Gieten the Netherlands

name: Honda Motoport
description: Motorcycle parts and service store. deals with all types of bikes. Excellent fast service for parts ordering and reasonable prices.

name: Camping Waterhout Almere
description: Campground for tents, caravans, RV. Also safari-tents for rent. Big rig friendly. Playground, restaurant, sanitair. Very nice people!

name: Camping de Oude Rijn Ter Aar
description: An established campground for campervans and tents. They also have little huts available.

name: De trekvogel
description: Nice space with a lot of campervans on a peer. Both side water from the Marker Lake

name: Oosterwolde
description:
"X-tech, Landrover specialist"
Owner Michiel Willems is a trustworthy, friendly mechanic with a lot of knowlegde about and love for any type of Landrover.

name: De Ommekeer
description:
Cute little campground for tents and vans.
The owner is very nice and helpful, he also speaks German. Facilites are clean, free WiFi, washing machine and drier available (3‚Ç¨ each). Kitchen for doing dishes. 
Plenty of dry seating space under a roof. 
Lake nearby for walks. 
For two persons in one tent with two motorbikes plus electricity we payed 23‚Ç¨.

name: Minicamping Tussen Hemel en Aarde
description:
Very cute campground with beautiful cabins for rent and space for vans and tents. 
Owner speaks English and German and takes care that the place is not too crowded. 
Facilities are clean, the place is quiet and has nice trails around for walking. 
Dogs are not allowed. Sinks for doing dishes available.

name: BCSB stadium parking
description: Huge parking lot where overnight parking is permitted.   Also used by truckers.  Quiet and secure.

name: parking behind the dunes
description:
nice spot behind the dunes out of wind.
there are 3 parkings.
at parking 1 there is drinking water.
this one is parking 3.
50 meter walk to the beach

name: Oliehandel Dekker B.V.   Behind TotalEnergies
description: Helpful service to finally fill our U.S. removable propane tank with their adapter. 20lb tank very empty- just shipped rig from South America- only took 5kg (11lb). Better than nothing!  Also carry many adapters, hoses and small bottles in their store.

name: Oirschot
description:
Quiet place on parking fish pond.
Sometimes local people come to fish.
Flat spots for small cars.
Cafe at 100 meter but only open in weekend.

name: Camperplaats Roerdalen
description:
electricity 16 Amp
showers
toilet
water
dumpstation
wifi

name: Kissing Couple
description:
Beside the smal  ferry port HEMPONTPLAIN a little car park for free. You can watch the ships and vessels or visit the culpture of the giant Kissing couple XXX.
At night time no ferry service , no noise.

Parking is free of charge. To Amsterdams central station is just 10 min driving.

name: Bivac Maarsen
description: Secluded in between bushes and trees. Close to-road and railway, so quite noisy. Not recommended unless really necessary. There is place for one 2-person tent
